snippet: After a police officer fatally shot an 18-year-old man in the Bronx on Thursday, the man’s grandmother was held against her will for hours, a friend of the family said.
abstract: Bronx woman Patricia Hartley claims that police held against her will and coerced her statement after her grandson Ramarley Graham was fatally shot by an officer; Hartley is said to be a crucial witness to the shooting of Graham, who was unarmed at the time, but her treatment by police is drawing close scrutiny and could become a sticking point in the investigation.

byline.original: By AL BAKER and TIM STELLOH

lead_paragraph: After a police officer fatally shot an 18-year-old man in the Bronx on Thursday, the man’s grandmother was held against her will for hours, a friend of the family said.

headline.seo: Treatment of Grandmother After Fatal Police Shooting Is Criticized
headline.main: Focus on Police Treatment of Witness After Shooting
headline.print_headline: Claim of Police Mistreatment of Witness
